reviews.review: It's a fun movie with predictable twists. My only real issue was the political theme of immigration being used in the story. That took away from my overall enjoyment of the movie. It was also nice seeing Chris Evans play someone other than Captain A.
Great plot and outstanding performance by all actors.

What I love about movies like this one is is gives the viewer plenty of angles to predict how the plot will go, and the film excites me when I guess outcomes correctly, but I get even more excited when I find out I guessed outcomes incorrectly and it keeps me at the edge of my seat wanting to know what REALLY happened. There were parts where my ADD brain felt overloaded with details so that's why I'm taking away half a star from a full five-star review, but the poetic ending justifies the parts I missed and didn't process as quickly.
I was impressed by Toni Collete's performance as a new-age freeloading lifestyle guru. I was taken unawares by her ability to get so into character. I also really appreciated that chick who played Joi in Blade Runner 2049 as the main character. She really gave the viewer their money's worth, because she could be innocent, she could not be innocent, she gave NOTHING away and I knew I was going to be shocked at the whodunnit at the end no matter what the outcome. Where a lot of mysteries fail in ways this film succeeds is the fact that clues are given, every character fits the stereotype of someone who could totally pull off a murder, but no one in this movie breaks out of character even just a little to give the impression that they're the real murderer or gives away any nuances that someone else will be the murderer. Mysteries should remain mysteries, unpredictable to the very end, and then all the clues come together and shock. It's what Agatha Christie did better than anyone, and the screenwriters met her juxtaposition formula with an equally resounding narrative.
Best movie I have seen in a while, the plot was really good, moderate effects, very interesting dialogues.
Loved it!! Great story, great characters and wonderful performances!!
Very entertaining, but pretty poor script. Slightly because I was hyped about the loaded cast & the trailers for the movie, but much different than I was expecting
kept me guessing till the end
Such a great sleuth.. literally the best one I have ever seen!

Really fun whodunnit with lots of twists. Terrific cast delivers in every scene. Don Johnson is a standout as a  whipped husband caught with his hand in the cookie jar. Jamie Lee Curtis is steely perfection, who never cracks. So so good.

Knives Out is definitely one of my favorite films of the year and also it means Rian Johnson's resurrection from the polemic "The Last Jedi", also the great cast conformed by Daniel Craig, Chris Evans, Ana de Armas, Toni Collete, Michael Shannon, Don Johnson, Jamie Lee Curtis, and others make this film sublime and incredible.
